title: Angkor, the lost city
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Asia, Southeastern - Description and travel
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Temples - Asia, Southeastern
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Temples - Asia, Southeastern
description: Angkor - a whole metropolis of palaces and temples recovered from the jungle which hid them for centuries until discovered in 1860 by a French naturalist. Monuments, picture tapestries in stone and Angkor Vat, a mile square temple of grey sandstone which no other church has rivalled in size, reveal the glories of the past empire of the Khmers, ancestors of the Cambodians.
